results:
Based on the search results, I found information about the first Polish translation and publication history of "The Great Gatsby" (Wielki Gatsby):

## First Polish Translation and Publication History

The book was published in the United States in 1925, and in Poland in 1965 – by Państwowy Instytut Wydawniczy with a translation by Ariadna Demkowska-Bohdziewicz.(no content)The first Polish edition of the famous novel "Wielki Gatsby" by F. Scott Fitzgerald.(no content)Nike series. Book from 1962.

There appears to be a slight discrepancy in the dates - one source mentions 1965 while another (an antiquarian bookshop) mentions 1962. The first Polish translation was done by **Ariadna Demkowska-Bohdziewicz** and published by **Państwowy Instytut Wydawniczy** (PIW) in the Nike series.

## Later Polish Editions

In subsequent years, the novel was also published by, among others, Wydawnictwo Literackie, Wydawnictwo Zysk i S-ka, Wydawnictwo Rebis, Wydawnictwo Prószyński i S-ka, Społeczny Instytut Wydawniczy Znak, Wydawnictwo Bellona, and SBM Renata Gmitrzak.(no content)In 2013, the book was published in a new, brilliant translation by Jacek Dehnel. This new translation by the renowned Polish writer and translator Jacek Dehnel was published by Wydawnictwo Znak and has been praised for giving the novel new life.

The novel has become an important part of Polish literary culture and continues to be republished by various publishers with different translations, most notably the modern 2013 translation by Jacek Dehnel.
